p: The total adipocyte count in the tail muscle was significantly higher in shrimp those fed with diets 3 and 7 compared to those fed diets 1, 2, 5 and 6; shrimp fed diet 1 had the lowest adipocyte count (Fig. 2A). The total cholesterol levels of the shrimp were unaffected by the dietary treatment (Fig. 2B). Intestinal lipase activity was lowest for shrimp fed diets 1, 4 and 5 and significantly lower than shrimp fed diets 7 or 8 (Fig. 2C). The amount of MDA was unaffected among the different treatments (Fig. 3A). SOD activity in shrimp fed diet 7 was significantly higher than those fed with diets 1, 2, or 3 (Fig. 3B). Similarly, CAT activity was significantly higher in shrimp those fed diet 7 than all other diets, except diet 4 (Fig. 3C).
